questions.question: How many demerit points are given if a rider/driver gets caught carrying passengers on a goods vehicle in a dangerous manner ?
questions.choice0: 8 demerit points and fine $300 for light vehicle and $400 for heavy vehicle.
questions.choice1: 9 demerit points and fine $300 for light vehicle and $400 for heavy vehicle.
questions.choice2: 10 demerit points and fine $300 for light vehicle and $400 for heavy vehicle.
questions.explaination: Answer B. Under the Driver Improvement Points (DIPS), 9 demerit points are given and a fine of $300 for light vehicles and $400 for heavy vehicles.

questions.question: What should you do when you see this sign?
questions.choice0: Slow down. Beware of road ending ahead.
questions.choice1: Keep left. Change to a lower gear. Overtake and U-turn or park your vehicle are allowed..
questions.choice2: Keep left. Change to a lower gear. Do not overtake, make a U-turn or park your vehicle.
questions.explaination: Answer C. Keep left. Change to a lower gear. Do not overtake, make a U-turn or park your vehicle.

questions.choice1: Car A

questions.question: Which is the following is the correct step when overtaking?
questions.choice0: 1) Check traffic ahead. 2) Check traffic behind. 3) Check bind Spot. 4) Signal right. 5) Move right. 6) Accelerate. 7) Tap horn (if neccessary). 8) Check mirror. 9) Signal left. 10) move left. 11) Cancel signal. 12) Resume normal speed.
questions.choice1: 1) Check traffic ahead. 2) Check traffic behind. 3) Signal right. 4) Check bind Spot. 5) Move right. 6) Accelerate. 7) Check mirror. 8) Signal left. 9) move left. 10) Cancel signal. 11) Resume normal speed.
questions.choice2: 1) Check traffic ahead. 2) Check traffic behind. 3) Signal right. 4) Check bind Spot. 5) Move right. 6) Accelerate. 7) Tap horn (if neccessary). 8) Check mirror. 9) Signal left. 10) move left. 11) Cancel signal. 12) Resume normal speed.
questions.explaination: Answer C. The 12 steps are 1) Check traffic ahead. 2) Check traffic behind. 3) Signal right. 4) Check bind Spot. 5) Move right. 6) Accelerate. 7) Tap horn (if neccessary). 8) Check mirror. 9) Signal left. 10) move left. 11) Cancel signal. 12) Resume normal speed.

questions.question: When you are appraching a roundabout, you should
questions.choice0: Slow down and give way to traffic on your left
questions.choice1: Slow down and give way to traffic on your right
questions.choice2: Slow down and do not give way
questions.explaination: Answer B. Slow down when approaching a roundabout and give way to traffic on your right.

questions.question: When approaching a road that is flooded but passable to vehicles, engage a ___ gear to go through the flood
questions.choice0: lower
questions.choice1: higher
questions.choice2: same

questions.question: When your path of travel get obstructed by road works or parked vehicles, you should
questions.choice0: Take extra care before moving right and you are not allow to cross the centre line if the roads are narrow.
questions.choice1: Take extra care before moving right and you can cross the centre line if the roads are narrow.
questions.choice2: Take extra care before moving left and you can cross the centre line if the roads are narrow.
questions.explaination: Answer B. Take extra care before moving right and you can cross the centre line if the roads are narrow.

questions.question: The prescribed legal limit for blood alcohol content is
questions.choice0: 80 milligrammes (mg) of alcohol per 100 millilitres (ml) of blood
questions.choice1: 100 milligrammes (mg) of alcohol per 100 millilitres (ml) of blood

questions.question: When you see this sign, you should
questions.choice0: Slow down before the white line. Give way to traffic from the right and left.
questions.choice1: Slow down and stop.
questions.choice2: Slow down. Stop if necessary. Give way to traffic on major road.
questions.explaination: Answer C. When you see a Give Way sign, you should Slow down. Stop if necessary. Give way to traffic on major roads.  Refer to page 9 of Online Basic Theory of Driving The Official Handbook published by Traffic Police.

questions.question: How many demerit points are given if a rider gets caught for  failing to wear, or wears a protective helmet insecurely?

questions.choice1: 4 demerit points and fine $150 for light vehicle and $200 for heavy vehicle.

questions.explaination: Answer A. Under the Driver Improvement Points (DIPS), 3 demerit points are given and a fine of $150 for light vehicles and $200 for heavy vehicles.

questions.question: Which of the following is correct when you are on a three-lane carriageway?
questions.choice0: You can keep to the centre lane when the left-hand is occupied by slower moving vehicles.
questions.choice1: You should drive at the left lane as you should always keep to your left.
questions.choice2: You should keep to the left lane as the middle and right are for emergency vehicles only.
questions.explaination: Answer A. You can keep to the centre lane when the left-hand is occupied by slower moving vehicles.
